review: The Incredibles ( 2004 ) is one of my favorite films of all time

review: What I loved about the original was the authenticity that the story , characters , and animation had to it .

review: It felt more creative , natural , and beautiful .

title: Can't Escape the Incredible Legacy of the Original
review: Syndrome was one of the greatest superhero movie villains of all time , not because of the amount of damage he was able to inflict upon the world ,

title: Can't Escape the Incredible Legacy of the Original
review: but because of the emotional pain he was able to cause Mr. Incredible and his family .

title: Can't Escape the Incredible Legacy of the Original
review: The moments in which Mr. Incredible regrets his past mistakes and realizes how his actions affect others , especially his former biggest fan , are what makes the film stand out from any other hero - villain dynamic .

title: Can't Escape the Incredible Legacy of the Original
review: Sadly , Incredibles 2 does not have a villain or story as deep or as thoughtful as Syndrome .

title: Can't Escape the Incredible Legacy of the Original
review: Incredibles 2 boldly and intelligently begins right where The Incredibles ended .

title: Can't Escape the Incredible Legacy of the Original
review: This smart move on Disney Pixar"s part eliminates all confusion and time gaps that may arise after a hiatus of any amount ( especially fourteen years ) between a sequel and its predecessor .

title: Can't Escape the Incredible Legacy of the Original
review: The story that follows is relatively contrived

title: Can't Escape the Incredible Legacy of the Original
review: and characters are clumsily introduced in order to expand the universe instead of expanding the emotions of the beloved characters .

title: Can't Escape the Incredible Legacy of the Original
review: The action scenes are creative and well - animated ,

title: Can't Escape the Incredible Legacy of the Original
review: but they aren"t memorable enough and take place in bland settings and accomplish nothing for the characters .

title: Can't Escape the Incredible Legacy of the Original
review: There were many points during this film where I noticed how hard Brad Bird was trying to replicate the formula of the original film ,

title: Can't Escape the Incredible Legacy of the Original
review: but it became more and more noticeable to the point that it detracted from the story itself .

title: Can't Escape the Incredible Legacy of the Original
review: The great Pixar films all have excellent , fluid stories .

title: Can't Escape the Incredible Legacy of the Original
review: The great Pixar films also have superb plots that deepen our understanding and feelings for the characters .

title: Can't Escape the Incredible Legacy of the Original
review: The good Pixar films have entertaining , sensible plots ,

title: Can't Escape the Incredible Legacy of the Original
review: but they rarely deepen our love of the characters involved in them , such as A Bug"s Life , Cars 2 ( don"t hate me ! ) , Cars 3 , and The Good Dinosaur .

title: Can't Escape the Incredible Legacy of the Original
review: Incredibles 2 , sadly , falls into the latter category that has a fun , creative plot ,

title: Can't Escape the Incredible Legacy of the Original
review: but a plot that does nothing new for its characters .

title: Can't Escape the Incredible Legacy of the Original

title: Pure Fun and Enjoyment
review: " Incredibles 2 " picks up right where it"s predecessor , " The Incredibles " left off , with the titular heroes , the Parr family , thrust into an exciting new adventure .

title: Pure Fun and Enjoyment
review: The plot focuses on Helen Parr , aka Elastigirl , with the help of millionaire businessman Winston Deavor and his sister Evelyn , trying to make superheroes legal again , while Bob Parr , aka Mr. Incredible , stays home with the kids .

title: Pure Fun and Enjoyment
review: When a new villain emerges with a dangerous plan to turn the general populace against Supers , the Incredibles , along with family - friend Frozone , must band together to stop the rogue .

title: Pure Fun and Enjoyment
review: but it"s still an interesting mystery .

title: Pure Fun and Enjoyment

title: Pure Fun and Enjoyment
review: The animation has greatly improved from the first film , with the characters and scenery looking better and more realistic than ever .

title: Pure Fun and Enjoyment
review: One aspect of this film I especially enjoyed is that we see more of the Parr family working together to take down the bad guy , with even the kids , Dash and Violet , helping to save the day .

title: Pure Fun and Enjoyment

You can"t give us a compelling , introspective story about Helen dealing with being an extremely famous superhero AND a mother ? You can"t give us a deep story regarding Bob balancing being a father and his wish to be a superhero again ? You can"t give us ANY reason to invest emotionally into this film ? That , quite frankly , is frustrating beyond belief .

title: Not As Good As the First, But Strong Enough!
review: Saw the first Incredible when I was 10 back in 2004 & now 14 years on we get a sequel we"ve all been dying for ! I"m now 23 going on 24 as I"m writing this & I found it to be a pretty awesome film ! The action was epic ! The story - line was pretty decent & the characters were pretty good too ! title: STILL reinforcing gender stereotypes
review: Some examples : Mr Incredible insists on going back to work instead of Elasta - Girl because " it"s just something I"ve got to do " ( read : " ... For my male ego " ) Mr Incredible inferring that he would be better to lead the campaign to promote super - heroes because " well , , , , you know ? ! " where he almost , but doesn"t quite say " because I"m a man and she"s a woman " Mr Incredible struggling to manage Elasta - Girl"s " female " work - childcare , feeding , bedtime , homework etc Mr Incredible gritting his teeth to be supportive but clearly hating it that Elasta - Girl is working

title: STILL reinforcing gender stereotypes
review: and doing super hero stuff while he"s a stay at home dad Elasta - girl ready to come home at a moment"s notice because she clearly doesn"t trust her husband to have it all under control ( she even " mispeaks " ) To the people saying that this is feminist propaganda , I have news for you .

title: STILL reinforcing gender stereotypes
review: None of these are positive messages ,

title: STILL reinforcing gender stereotypes
review: and all of them actually serve to reinforce the gender stereotypes Pixar appear to be clumsily attempting to combat .

title: STILL reinforcing gender stereotypes
review: In fact , a positive gender equal message would be Mr Incredible actually delighted that his wife is chosen to lead the campaign , and genuinely supportive .

review: It would be to show him delighted that he can stay home

review: and spend time with his kids .

title: STILL reinforcing gender stereotypes
review: Her showing confidence in his ability to manage okay .

title: STILL reinforcing gender stereotypes
review: I get that these are plot devices ,

title: STILL reinforcing gender stereotypes
review: but they are OLD FASHIONED , and patronize both men and women ( in many ways , men more so.)You could have made the same film without patronizing men and their ability to be stay - at - home parents , or reinforcing the message that men should feel emasculated by women working and being more of a success than them .

title: A well-made follow-up to one of Pixar's best movies and a solid superhero film in its own right
review: Incredibles 2 is the long - awaited sequel to the Disney Pixar classic The Incredibles .

title: A well-made follow-up to one of Pixar's best movies and a solid superhero film in its own right
review: Written and directed by Brad Bird ( The Iron Giant , Ratatouille ) , it is a well - made follow - up to one of Pixar"s best movies and a solid superhero film in its own right .

title: A well-made follow-up to one of Pixar's best movies and a solid superhero film in its own right
review: A short time after the events of the first film , the Parr family , Bob / Mr. Incredible ( Craig T. Nelson ) , Helen / Elastigirl ( Holly Hunter ) , Violet ( Sarah Vowell ) , Dash ( Huck Milner ) , and Jack - Jack , continue to protect their city from danger while also trying to live out their lives as normal citizens .

title: A well-made follow-up to one of Pixar's best movies and a solid superhero film in its own right
review: One day , Helen is recruited by an organisation called DEVTECH , who are devoted to restoring the reputation of superheroes and regaining their popularity with the public .

title: A well-made follow-up to one of Pixar's best movies and a solid superhero film in its own right
review: With his wife now away working for DEVTECH , Bob is tasked with looking after the kids and tending to their needs , which proves to be much easier said than done .

title: 14 Years Later: Incredibles Has Matured in Content with Impressive Results
review: Things have changed greatly since the lighthearted 2004 Pixar hit The Incredibles .

title: 14 Years Later: Incredibles Has Matured in Content with Impressive Results
review: In this 2018 sequel , it feels more darker in content - like on the boundary line of PG to PG-13 - compared to its predecessor .

title: 14 Years Later: Incredibles Has Matured in Content with Impressive Results
review: See , unlike the original which played on the superhero genre of the early 2000s with sitcom - like humor , this feels like a blend of the current decade"s juggernaut of ever - growing superhero movies with some maturity in these characters we"ve come to know those years ago .

title: In some ways a perfect sequel, in other ways disappointing - but a slick and solid adventure either way
review: The hesitancy to make a sequel to The Incredibles was understandable .

title: In some ways a perfect sequel, in other ways disappointing - but a slick and solid adventure either way
review: While its on - the - nose cavalier suave wasn"t for everyone , the first film was so well - paced and balanced between action and drama that planning out a worthy follow - up was almost impossible .

title: In some ways a perfect sequel, in other ways disappointing - but a slick and solid adventure either way
review: The first film also did something incredible ( pun intended ) by balancing nostalgia for superheroes with a unique angle that made them very mortal beings and set it apart from other super movies .

title: In some ways a perfect sequel, in other ways disappointing - but a slick and solid adventure either way
review: In some ways , Incredibles 2 did the best job possible of leading where the other left off .

title: In some ways a perfect sequel, in other ways disappointing - but a slick and solid adventure either way
review: Rather than kidding anyone by trying to step over the Underminer ending of the first film , it picks up

title: In some ways a perfect sequel, in other ways disappointing - but a slick and solid adventure either way
review: and shows us the epic action sequence that we expected to see .

title: In some ways a perfect sequel, in other ways disappointing - but a slick and solid adventure either way
review: With animation that is updated yet extremely faithful to the original , the movie maintains the fast - paced mix of intense action , stylish moves , and funny family drama .

title: In some ways a perfect sequel, in other ways disappointing - but a slick and solid adventure either way
review: At moments it even captures that dazzling feeling of seeing the inventions of the Incredibles universe for the first time .

title: In some ways a perfect sequel, in other ways disappointing - but a slick and solid adventure either way
review: Instead of trying too hard to go in a new direction , it almost acts like a " next installment " by keeping many of the plot elements of the first movie but reversing many of the roles .

title: In some ways a perfect sequel, in other ways disappointing - but a slick and solid adventure either way
review: This makes it a wholly enjoyable watch that isn"t missing many things we were hoping for .

title: In some ways a perfect sequel, in other ways disappointing - but a slick and solid adventure either way
review: At the same time , the by - the - numbers emulation of the first movie"s greatness makes ever meeting or surpassing its greatness impossible .

title: In some ways a perfect sequel, in other ways disappointing - but a slick and solid adventure either way
review: Incredibles 2 is , for all its efforts , essentially a repeat of the first story .

title: In some ways a perfect sequel, in other ways disappointing - but a slick and solid adventure either way
review: Since it"s not entering uncharted territory and stays in the comfy zone of predictability , the stakes feel much lower than they did in the first movie .

title: In some ways a perfect sequel, in other ways disappointing - but a slick and solid adventure either way
review: What I found most disappointing , though , was that the maturity and subtlety levels went downward for this sequel , as most of the character development of the first movie was completely reset for the new movie .

title: In some ways a perfect sequel, in other ways disappointing - but a slick and solid adventure either way
review: Bob and Helen Parr were almost acting like irritating caricatures of themselves rather than a couple who had gone through any major breakthough together ,

title: In some ways a perfect sequel, in other ways disappointing - but a slick and solid adventure either way
review: and the kids were back to bickering and whining for much of the movie before their maturity was allowed to return .

title: In some ways a perfect sequel, in other ways disappointing - but a slick and solid adventure either way
review: While Jack Jack"s antics were funny and inevitable , his prolonged presence on the screen felt like a band - aid for the unpredictability that was missing .

title: In some ways a perfect sequel, in other ways disappointing - but a slick and solid adventure either way
review: I know it"s not fair to hold Pixar up to a godly standard for each of its films ,

title: In some ways a perfect sequel, in other ways disappointing - but a slick and solid adventure either way
review: but some of the immaturity and the gimmicks of Incredibles 2 felt like the things that lesser - regarded studios would resort to rather than them .

title: In some ways a perfect sequel, in other ways disappointing - but a slick and solid adventure either way
review: Incredibles 2 doesn"t attempt nor come close to replacing its source movie , which is perhaps wise but also removes its capacity to be a great movie .

title: In some ways a perfect sequel, in other ways disappointing - but a slick and solid adventure either way
review: We"re still left with many of the great things that entertained and wowed us in the first movie -

title: In some ways a perfect sequel, in other ways disappointing - but a slick and solid adventure either way
review: and the hopes that another installment isn"t too far behind .

title: Incredibles 2
review: It had been fourteen years since the first Disney / Pixar computer animated movie , a month or two before the official release critics were being very positive about this sequel , I was really looking forward seeing to it , directed by Brad Bird ( The Iron Giant , Ratatouille , Mission : Impossible - Ghost Protocol ) .

title: Incredibles 2
review: Basically it picks right up where it left off , three months after defeating Syndrome , the Parr family : father / husband Bob aka Mr. Incredible ( Craig T. Nelson ) , mother / wife Helen aka Elastigirl ( Holly Hunter ) , son Dashiell " Dash " ( Huck Milner ) and daughter Violet ( Sarah Vowell ) work together , with fellow superhero Lucius Best / Frozone ( Samuel L. Jackson ) , to try

title: Incredibles 2
review: and stop The Underminer ( John Ratzenberger ) .

title: Incredibles 2
review: But as in the past , they only manage to cause more damage , meaning lawsuits ,

title: Incredibles 2
review: and the reputation of superheroes in Metroville , since the legal ban of them , has not been improved .

title: Incredibles 2
review: Then Bob and Helen meet superhero fan Winston Deavor ( Breaking Bad"s Bob Odenkirk ) , owner of telecommunications corporation DevTech , he and his genius inventor sister Evelyn ( Catherine Keener ) propose a series of publicity stunts to help regain public support and trust in Supers .

title: Incredibles 2
review: Helen is chosen as the spearhead for this campaign , while the rest of the Parr family are given a new home .

title: Incredibles 2
review: Bob is jealous of Helen getting superhero missions , while he has to be a stay - at - home dad , he is helping Dash with his complicated maths homework , Violet is mad at him after her crush Tony Rydinger ( Michael Bird ) had his memory erased by government agent Rick Dicker ( Jonathan Banks ) before a date they had arranged , and baby Jack - Jack is causing chaos with his multiple superpowers .

title: Incredibles 2
review: While Bob gets super fashion designer Edna Mode ( Brad Bird ) to temporarily babysit Jack - Jack ,

title: Incredibles 2
review: and he helps out his other two kids , Elastigirl is constantly confronted by Screenslaver , a mysterious supervillain who projects hypnotic images through television screens .

title: Incredibles 2
review: It is later revealed that Evelyn is Screenslaver ,

title: Incredibles 2
review: and has the power to control minds , including those of Supers , she plans to stop the government from ever changing the law of Supers existing in and serving society .

title: Incredibles 2
review: Many Supers are captured and hypnotised to serve Evelyn ,

title: Incredibles 2
review: but Violet , Dash , and Jack - Jack escape , and snapping their parents and Frozone out of the trance , they work together to stop a large plot publicity stunt that threatens the city .

title: Incredibles 2
review: In the end , the city is saved ,

title: Incredibles 2
review: and Evelyn is arrested for her crimes , and Supers around the world regain full legal status , but of course , the Parrs can not relax for long as another bad guy is being chased by the police .

title: Incredibles 2
review: Also starring Sophia Bush as Karen / Voyd , Phil LaMarr as Krushauer and He - Lectrix , Paul Eiding as Gus Burns / Reflux , Isabella Rossellini as The Ambassador , Barry Bostwick as Mayor and Usher as Lucius Best"s valet .

title: Incredibles 2
review: The voice actors all do their parts well , the animation is fantastic , the story is interesting , it is exciting in the right moments ,

title: Incredibles 2
review: and it has some great laughs , the best and funniest scenes are with Jack - Jack , just about as enjoyable as the original , a terrific animated comedy adventure .

title: Incredibles 2
review: It was nominated the Oscar for Best Animated Feature Film , it was nominated the BAFTA for Best Animated Feature Film ,

title: Incredibles 2
review: and it was nominated the Golden Globe for Best Motion Picture - Animated . Very good !

title: there are no eye-popping new characters or spectacles to deaden the over-familiarity
review: A 3D viewing of Pixar"s 12th feature film , INCREDIBLES 2 , an overdue sequel , 14 years after its 2004 blockbuster , a time even Bryan Singer"s much maligned reboot SUPERMAN RETURNS ( 2006 ) had yet to reach the silver screen , a very different picture from today"s glut of superhero consumption .

title: there are no eye-popping new characters or spectacles to deaden the over-familiarity
review: INCREDIBLES 2"s biggest challenge , save for treating its gaping generational shift with kid gloves ( viz , drawing on the nostalgia of Generation Y

title: there are no eye-popping new characters or spectacles to deaden the over-familiarity
review: and recruiting new kids who might have no inkling of its predecessor ) , comes to that daunting question , as an art - form , what animation could excel if its live - action counterpart can also achieve a similar if more captivating visual effects ? Especially when the storyboard is strictly human - based , on a general afterthought , nothing in this film seems to strictly require this treatment ( the most demanding parts might be Elastigirl and baby Jack - Jack"s psionic powers ) ,

title: there are no eye-popping new characters or spectacles to deaden the over-familiarity
review: and the answer to that question does not look rosy .

title: there are no eye-popping new characters or spectacles to deaden the over-familiarity
review: With Brad Bird returning to preside over the project after his live - action sorties in MISSION : IMPOSSIBLE - GHOST PROTOCOL ( 2011 ) and TOMORROWLAND ( 2015 ) , INCREDIBLES 2 grandly carries Pixar"s torch in concocting a sagacious and innovative story - line out of the genre"s default family - friendly tenet , here , we have an appreciable role - swapping borne out of USA"s current climate"s gender study , Elastigirl becomes the breadwinner while Mr. Incredible takes a back seat in attending to their kids , indeed it is the latter part that registers most fun and laughter , a stay - at - home dad"s quagmire is brimful of hilarity and commiseration , tonally chimes in with its preceding short Domee Shi"s BAO , depicting a typical empty nest phenomenon from a mother"s angle , vamped up with an oriental touch .

title: there are no eye-popping new characters or spectacles to deaden the over-familiarity
review: What becomes problematic is the well - worn trope of saving the world from some evil intrigue , a very American clichÃ © Bird has no intention of steering away , although through the message from and the designation of its ostensible antagonist Screenslaver , the film manages to alert viewers of today"s pandemic inertia and non - action that partly can be chalked up to a pernicious passivity hugely influenced by notion of waiting for a superhero ,

title: there are no eye-popping new characters or spectacles to deaden the over-familiarity
review: and an attention span deformed by our screen - gazing mentation ,

title: there are no eye-popping new characters or spectacles to deaden the over-familiarity
review: but that sounds too adult - minded , hence , its lucid cogitation about superpowers expectedly and frustratingly gives way to a conventional , business - as - usual denouement , which overall , renders the picture a few notches below Pixar"s more esteemed titles .

title: there are no eye-popping new characters or spectacles to deaden the over-familiarity
review: Back to my initial question , the impact of its sleek strings of action set pieces ineluctably pales in comparison with the ones from its more visceral live - action cousins , as there are no eye - popping new characters or spectacles to deaden the over - familiarity ,

title: there are no eye-popping new characters or spectacles to deaden the over-familiarity
review: and admittedly , speaking from a personal perspective , the allure of animation and one"s own age have been in inverse proportion ever since one reaches adolescence , if only that could be the sole legit excuse for one"s mild disappointment of this case .

title: A second outing for The Incredibles that comes a decade too late.
review: Back when superhero films were starting to become successful ( albeit , not nearly as lucratively successful as the Marvel Cinematic Universe ) , The Incredibles artfully blended a superhero film with a family / midlife crisis plot that worked on so many levels .

title: The Super-Family's Back, But it's Not the Same
review: Picking up immediately after the first film , we find Bob , Helen and the kids still navigating the tricky waters of superhuman illegality , despite saving the world in a handful of very public conflicts .

title: The Super-Family's Back, But it's Not the Same
review: It"s great to see the whole cast back again , from headliners Holly Hunter and Craig T. Nelson to supporting players like Samuel L. Jackson ,

title: The Super-Family's Back, But it's Not the Same
review: and the effects have never looked better .

title: The Super-Family's Back, But it's Not the Same
review: Pixar almost always seems to one - up themselves in that respect ,

title: The Super-Family's Back, But it's Not the Same
review: but it still bears mentioning - Incredibles 2 is a real sensory spectacle .

title: The Super-Family's Back, But it's Not the Same
review: The primary story is a let - down , though , like something I"d expect to find in a filler issue between big events .

title: The Super-Family's Back, But it's Not the Same
review: After fourteen years away , I would"ve hoped for something with a bit more emotional punch , an adventure that feels more essential and complex .

title: The Super-Family's Back, But it's Not the Same
review: Instead , it loosely apes a few smaller subplots from the first film , swaps the headline roles , tosses in a few lazy , telegraphed twists and then wraps it all up on an empty happy note .

title: The Super-Family's Back, But it's Not the Same
review: Visually dazzling , with a good sense of humor , but generally quite hollow and , sadly , almost completely missing the warm , witty commentary on classic superhero stereotypes that made the original work on so many levels .

title: The Super-Family's Back, But it's Not the Same
review: This felt like a B - team"s admirable ,

title: The Super-Family's Back, But it's Not the Same
review: but failed , effort to step up to the big leagues .

title: Incredibles 2 Packs an Action Punch, but Lacks the Original's Creative Spark
review: Since 2010 , Pixar , the one - time CG animation juggernaut , has been crippled by the sequel bug .

title: Incredibles 2 Packs an Action Punch, but Lacks the Original's Creative Spark
review: The studio that for a solid decade plus made nothing but modern classics , has in recent years strained to imitate the formula that launched them into the animation stratosphere in 1995 .

title: Incredibles 2 Packs an Action Punch, but Lacks the Original's Creative Spark
review: The result of this effort ? Sequels to nearly all of their most beloved films .

title: Incredibles 2 Packs an Action Punch, but Lacks the Original's Creative Spark
review: Their latest , and possibly most anticipated , is Incredibles 2 .

title: Incredibles 2 Packs an Action Punch, but Lacks the Original's Creative Spark
review: The original Incredibles is one of the five most influential movies of my childhood ,

title: Incredibles 2 Packs an Action Punch, but Lacks the Original's Creative Spark
review: and a perfect action movie in its own right ,

title: Incredibles 2 Packs an Action Punch, but Lacks the Original's Creative Spark
review: yet I was firmly in the minority when it came to the possible sequel .

title: Incredibles 2 Packs an Action Punch, but Lacks the Original's Creative Spark
review: I didn"t want one , and I suspect its writer and director Brad Bird didn"t either .

title: Incredibles 2 Packs an Action Punch, but Lacks the Original's Creative Spark
review: Because after a 14 - year hiatus , The Incredibles sequel arrives with all the action and humor of the original ,

title: Incredibles 2 Packs an Action Punch, but Lacks the Original's Creative Spark
review: but none of its passion .

title: Incredibles 2 Packs an Action Punch, but Lacks the Original's Creative Spark
review: Incredibles 2 begins immediately where The Incredibles ended ; with The Underminer on the verge of a high - profile bank heist ,

title: Incredibles 2 Packs an Action Punch, but Lacks the Original's Creative Spark
review: and the newly assembled Incredibles ready to take him down .

title: Incredibles 2 Packs an Action Punch, but Lacks the Original's Creative Spark
review: After that rousing introductory action scene , we are introduced to our new characters , Evelyn and Winston Deavor ( Catherine Keener and Bob Odenkirk ) , a brother and sister duo determined to legalize " supers " .

title: Incredibles 2 Packs an Action Punch, but Lacks the Original's Creative Spark
review: To do this , they recruit Mr. Incredible , Elastigirl , and Frozone , to take on a publicity tour of sorts , and create goodwill among the people .

title: Incredibles 2 Packs an Action Punch, but Lacks the Original's Creative Spark
review: Elastigirl is given the biggest spotlight , leaving her husband at home with the superkids .

title: Incredibles 2 Packs an Action Punch, but Lacks the Original's Creative Spark
review: So the story goes , with Helen Parr performing grand acts of heroism while tracking down the mysterious Screenslaver ,

title: Incredibles 2 Packs an Action Punch, but Lacks the Original's Creative Spark
review: and Bob struggling to keep up at home .

title: Incredibles 2 Packs an Action Punch, but Lacks the Original's Creative Spark
review: Throw in a handful of quirky new superheroes ,

title: Incredibles 2 Packs an Action Punch, but Lacks the Original's Creative Spark
review: and some spy thriller elements , and you have a plot that differs enough from the first film , but never does quite enough to justify itself as a natural continuation of the story .

title: Incredibles 2 Packs an Action Punch, but Lacks the Original's Creative Spark
review: The Screenslaver is an interesting villain ,

title: Incredibles 2 Packs an Action Punch, but Lacks the Original's Creative Spark
review: and the mystery plot unfolds in relatively surprising ways ,

title: Incredibles 2 Packs an Action Punch, but Lacks the Original's Creative Spark
review: but I couldn"t shake the feeling that this story was simply one of hundreds of possible exploits for the Incredible family . It pulls you in ,

title: Incredibles 2 Packs an Action Punch, but Lacks the Original's Creative Spark
review: but only as much as a new episode of your favorite TV show might .

title: Incredibles 2 Packs an Action Punch, but Lacks the Original's Creative Spark
review: For me , that was plenty ,

title: Incredibles 2 Packs an Action Punch, but Lacks the Original's Creative Spark
review: but for fans feverish over where the series might head , it may be a disappointment .

title: Incredibles 2 Packs an Action Punch, but Lacks the Original's Creative Spark
review: Incredibles 2 matches the first film in most important measures .

title: Incredibles 2 Packs an Action Punch, but Lacks the Original's Creative Spark
review: Particularly the action and pacing that made The Incredibles so much more than just another cartoon .

title: Incredibles 2 Packs an Action Punch, but Lacks the Original's Creative Spark
review: Despite directing only two or three films that can be considered " action movies " , Brad Bird has managed to position himself as one of the great action directors working .

title: Incredibles 2 Packs an Action Punch, but Lacks the Original's Creative Spark
review: His work on Incredibles 2 once again proves why .

title: Incredibles 2 Packs an Action Punch, but Lacks the Original's Creative Spark
review: Through several impossibly complex set - pieces , including an exceptional train rescue , Bird uses animation and action together like the maestro he is celebrated as .

title: Incredibles 2 Packs an Action Punch, but Lacks the Original's Creative Spark
review: Because he"s working within an animated comic book world , these action scenes always have something new up their sleeves .

title: Incredibles 2 Packs an Action Punch, but Lacks the Original's Creative Spark
review: The various superpowers are utilized so deftly that it makes the Marvel and DC movies look like they"re not even trying .

title: Incredibles 2 Packs an Action Punch, but Lacks the Original's Creative Spark
review: Animation liberates great filmmakers , and if you needed more evidence that Brad Bird is indeed a great filmmaker , the truly rousing action scenes in Incredibles 2 should put that to bed .

title: Incredibles 2 Packs an Action Punch, but Lacks the Original's Creative Spark
review: The film is also remarkably well paced .

title: Incredibles 2 Packs an Action Punch, but Lacks the Original's Creative Spark
review: There are two distinctly different stories going on simultaneously , one a taut thriller and the other a family comedy ,

title: Incredibles 2 Packs an Action Punch, but Lacks the Original's Creative Spark
review: and it doesn"t feel as if either is given too much or too little attention .

title: Incredibles 2 Packs an Action Punch, but Lacks the Original's Creative Spark
review: That means the film moves steadily and purposefully ,

title: Incredibles 2 Packs an Action Punch, but Lacks the Original's Creative Spark
review: but still allows for laugh breaks and breathers .

title: Incredibles 2 Packs an Action Punch, but Lacks the Original's Creative Spark
review: That doesn"t mean both story threads are equally good , though .

title: Incredibles 2 Packs an Action Punch, but Lacks the Original's Creative Spark
review: The home life stuff starts off as a pointedly funny look at superpowered parenting , before becoming a hit or miss sitcom by the end .

title: Incredibles 2 Packs an Action Punch, but Lacks the Original's Creative Spark
review: If you like baby noises , boy is this for you ! Me ? I found Jack Jack"s antics ( involving his increasing number of powers ) annoying .

title: Incredibles 2 Packs an Action Punch, but Lacks the Original's Creative Spark
review: Baby giggles are low hanging fruit for a sequel whose predecessor was so naturally , and confidently clever in its humor .

title: Incredibles 2 Packs an Action Punch, but Lacks the Original's Creative Spark
review: I was also struck by how off line the voice performances were .

title: Incredibles 2 Packs an Action Punch, but Lacks the Original's Creative Spark
review: Craig T. Nelson sounds totally disinterested throughout ,

title: Incredibles 2 Packs an Action Punch, but Lacks the Original's Creative Spark
review: and the supporting characters are always pushing a little too hard for a laugh .

review: Holly Hunter is the only one to recapture the casually natural sound that made the first movie special .

title: Incredibles 2 Packs an Action Punch, but Lacks the Original's Creative Spark
review: It all leads back to my initial hypothesis .

title: Incredibles 2 Packs an Action Punch, but Lacks the Original's Creative Spark
review: I don"t think Brad Bird really wanted to make this movie .

title: Incredibles 2 Packs an Action Punch, but Lacks the Original's Creative Spark
review: Why else for the 14 - year gap ? It"s not as if the script connected to the first in any meaningful way , or broke any new ground .

title: Incredibles 2 Packs an Action Punch, but Lacks the Original's Creative Spark
review: It"s simply a hunk of meat , thrown to the fans to shut them up .

title: Incredibles 2 Packs an Action Punch, but Lacks the Original's Creative Spark
review: And at the same time , it"s really good .

title: Incredibles 2 Packs an Action Punch, but Lacks the Original's Creative Spark
review: Bird is the key player .

review: He"s a great filmmaker , and he keeps Incredibles 2 lively and fun .

title: Incredibles 2 Packs an Action Punch, but Lacks the Original's Creative Spark
review: So a few gags failed to land , so what ? The film works .

title: Incredibles 2 Packs an Action Punch, but Lacks the Original's Creative Spark
review: The action scenes pop off the screen , the story moves along briskly ,

title: Incredibles 2 Packs an Action Punch, but Lacks the Original's Creative Spark
review: and there are good , hardy laughs along the way .

title: Incredibles 2 Packs an Action Punch, but Lacks the Original's Creative Spark
review: You can"t recapture lightning in a bottle .

title: Incredibles 2 Packs an Action Punch, but Lacks the Original's Creative Spark
review: Incredibles 2 doesn"t .

title: Incredibles 2 Packs an Action Punch, but Lacks the Original's Creative Spark
review: But in terms of sequels , I can live with something that entertains and thrills heartily , even if it doesn"t meet the original"s passion . 76/100

title: An INCREDIBLE sequel...
review: Like a good sequel should , Incredibles 2 continues the story with fresh ideas and dilemmas for each character .

title: An INCREDIBLE sequel...
review: What it does better than the original is its focus on the entire Parr family

title: An INCREDIBLE sequel...
review: and how they juggle both hero and civilian life .

title: An INCREDIBLE sequel...
review: I adore the first Incredibles ,

title: An INCREDIBLE sequel...
review: but most of the focus was centered on Mr. Incredible and his personal crisis of reliving the glory days .

title: An INCREDIBLE sequel...
review: In the sequel , we not only follow Elastigirl"s action - packed new job ,

title: An INCREDIBLE sequel...
review: but we also explore Mr. Incredible trying to connect closer with his children who he hardly interacted with in the first film .

title: An INCREDIBLE sequel...
review: Not only does he need to tame Jack - Jack and his chaotic new abilities ,

title: An INCREDIBLE sequel...
review: but he must also console his teenage daughter Violet as she endures boy troubles , and help his son Dash who is struggling with his schoolwork .

title: An INCREDIBLE sequel...
review: This is new territory for Mr. Incredible

title: An INCREDIBLE sequel...
review: and it results in some genuinely funny and touching chemistry , and I personally think its where the film soars at its highest .

title: An INCREDIBLE sequel...
review: The movie is called The Incredibles , which suggests the movie is about all of them , therefore featuring a strong family connection is essential , and the sequel does a better job at that .

title: An INCREDIBLE sequel...
review: With each viewing of the original film , I found myself more and more impressed with the subtle lore that The Incredibles " universe possesses .

title: An INCREDIBLE sequel...
review: Their world is set in a supremely anachronistic 1960s era where technology has rapidly heightened .

title: An INCREDIBLE sequel...
review: Incredibles 2 doesn"t ignore this mythology and expands it with blinding creativity .

title: An INCREDIBLE sequel...
review: From the architecture , to the clothing , to the machinery , the film is absolutely dripping with a retro - futuristic imagery .

title: An INCREDIBLE sequel...
review: The mythos regarding superheroes is a charming call back to the golden age of superhero comics and cartoons , with the colorful suits , flashy names , and a diverse array of abilities that opens the door for tons of fast - paced inventiveness during the action sequences .

title: An INCREDIBLE sequel...
review: It"s an engrossing and smartly - designed world ,

title: An INCREDIBLE sequel...
review: yet Brad Bird keeps the focus where it should be : On the family and their story .

title: An INCREDIBLE sequel...
review: The imagery and lore has a casual but unique and dazzling prescience that requires more than one viewing to fully absorb .

title: An INCREDIBLE sequel...
review: The original film , however , does one element a lot better than the sequel , and that"s the main antagonist .

title: An INCREDIBLE sequel...
review: Screenslaver , despite a clever title , is nothing remarkable

title: An INCREDIBLE sequel...
review: and his promise is sort of squandered .

title: An INCREDIBLE sequel...
review: There"s a twist surrounding this villain that is quite foreseeable and the pay off isn"t very memorable at all .

title: An INCREDIBLE sequel...
review: In fact , the " surprise villain " trope is getting very tired , especially in Disney .

title: An INCREDIBLE sequel...
review: It was there in Wreck - It Ralph , Frozen , Zootopia , and Coco . GIVE IT A REST .

title: An INCREDIBLE sequel...
review: On better terms , this allows the aforementioned family dynamic to shine more .

title: An INCREDIBLE sequel...
review: The fact of the matter is : Screenslaver is no Syndrome , who was by all outward appearances a more interesting , outright adversary , and perhaps one of the Disney"s greatest baddies .

title: An INCREDIBLE sequel...
review: He was intelligent and charismatic ,

title: An INCREDIBLE sequel...
review: but also ruthlessly cruel and murderous ; a loser who was motivated from years of jealousy and neglect .

title: An INCREDIBLE sequel...
review: With that aside , I did enjoy the new characters .

title: An INCREDIBLE sequel...
review: Bob Odenkirk of Breaking Bad and Better Call Saul fame really captured Winston Deavor"s suave and idealistic charm ,

title: An INCREDIBLE sequel...
review: and I"m happy the actor is receiving more high profile work .

title: An INCREDIBLE sequel...
review: The new band of superheroes that Elastigirl meets , despite their minimal screentime , are likable

title: An INCREDIBLE sequel...
review: and serve an extravagant purpose during the climax .

title: An INCREDIBLE sequel...
review: I must praise Michael Giacchino"s musical score .

title: An INCREDIBLE sequel...
review: It"s jazzy , thematic , and exploding with adrenaline .

title: An INCREDIBLE sequel...
review: Excellent range overall , his scores never disappoint .

title: An INCREDIBLE sequel...
review: The animation , compared to the original film , has skyrocketed in quality .

title: An INCREDIBLE sequel...
review: The character designs are more brisk and expressive , similar to Brad Bird"s traditionally - animated masterpiece The Iron Giant , where many characters displayed a wide range of evocative reactions .

title: An INCREDIBLE sequel...
review: There is one scene where Jack - Jack battles a raccoon ,

title: An INCREDIBLE sequel...
review: and the critter"s movements are brilliantly animated .

title: An INCREDIBLE sequel...
review: Snappy and comedic , yet not ignoring its natural , reactive behavior .

title: An INCREDIBLE sequel...
review: The entire scene reminded me of a Chuck Jones cartoon , it was very slapstick

title: An INCREDIBLE sequel...
review: but didn"t feel out of place .

title: An INCREDIBLE sequel...
review: Additionally , there"s a scene where Violet encounters his crush Tony Rydinger at a restaurant and she sprays water out of her nose in surprise .

title: An INCREDIBLE sequel...
review: Kinda gross in theory ,

title: An INCREDIBLE sequel...
review: but the exaggerated , cartoony expression on her face as it happened really sold the moment as pure comedy .

title: An INCREDIBLE sequel...
review: It came out of nowhere and I was laughing hard , probably harder than I ever have in my history of seeing movies in the theater .

title: An INCREDIBLE sequel...
review: I also appreciate how Tony Rydinger looks more boyish than he did in the original , almost resembling Hogarth Hughes from The Iron Giant .

title: An INCREDIBLE sequel...
review: His look in the first film didn"t seem right , he more resembled a man in his early 20s .

title: An INCREDIBLE sequel...
review: Major props to the improved animation .

title: An INCREDIBLE sequel...
review: It not only supported the action ,

title: An INCREDIBLE sequel...
review: but the humor as well .

title: An INCREDIBLE sequel...
review: To conclude , Incredibles 2 is a mighty fine sequel .

title: An INCREDIBLE sequel...
review: The family has a strong and amusing chemistry ,

title: An INCREDIBLE sequel...
review: and the action is fast - paced and stylish .

title: An INCREDIBLE sequel...
review: It shows Brad Bird still carries a gift for telling effectively character - driven stories without sacrificing thrills .

title: An INCREDIBLE sequel...
review: The only thing hampering the film down is its weak and predictable villain .

title: An INCREDIBLE sequel...
review: It was great seeing these characters on the big screen again after 14 years .

title: Losing the Incredibles Magic
review: TL ; DR While this film is visually and aurally appealing in Pixar standards , this film drops a lot of the aspects that made the original Incredibles unique in favor of a more box office friendly approach .

title: Losing the Incredibles Magic
review: As a preface , I adored the first Incredibles growing up ,

title: Losing the Incredibles Magic
review: and after re - watching it in preparation for this film , I still adore it .

title: Losing the Incredibles Magic
review: So , this review will carry some bias , because I think the Incredibles 2 is a perfectly OK film by itself .

title: Losing the Incredibles Magic
review: What this film has going is its updated visuals , interesting and engaging action scenes , and music ; or in general its aesthetic .

title: Losing the Incredibles Magic
review: Originally Director Brad Bird wanted the visuals of the Incredibles to mimic that of those Golden Age - Superhero posters back in the 50s/60s ,

title: Losing the Incredibles Magic
review: and while the first film did a great job in context to what technology was available , this sequel nails it .

title: Losing the Incredibles Magic
review: The skyscrapers were massive and follow the simple geometry of modernist architecture , the trains , cars , and other vehicles were all futuristic in a modernist sense ( again ) , the music while not so different from the original film was still magnificent and brassy , and the action was very impressive and flashy whereas the original film didn"t have too many opportunities to show off this sort of choreography .

title: Losing the Incredibles Magic
review: And while the plot , characters , and script were meh , without the context of the original this film is a perfectly OK 5/10

title: Losing the Incredibles Magic
review: and a perfect rental if you want to appreciate the high quality artistic direction that Pixar produces .

title: Losing the Incredibles Magic
review: Now that being said , this film loses almost all the magic the original had .

title: Losing the Incredibles Magic
review: To keep this readable , I"ll just mention two of the most annoying aspects of the film

title: Losing the Incredibles Magic
review: but be sure I had other qualms with this film

title: Losing the Incredibles Magic
review: and you can find most of them in other reviews .

title: Losing the Incredibles Magic
review: The first aspect is line delivery .

title: Losing the Incredibles Magic
review: In re - watching the original , I noticed how snappy , quick , and sticky the dialogue was .

title: Losing the Incredibles Magic
review: Most people I know have at least memorized 2 scenes from the original

title: Losing the Incredibles Magic
review: and I can almost guarantee YOU the reader know the super suit scene by heart .

title: Losing the Incredibles Magic
review: Now how many lines from the Incredibles 2 can you recite ? Maybe the " Math is Math " line

title: Losing the Incredibles Magic
review: but that might be it .

title: Losing the Incredibles Magic
review: One part of why this is because the voice actors who weren"t in the original did not follow the cadence and speed that original voice actors , the most blatant violator being the voice actor for Void .

title: Losing the Incredibles Magic
review: Instead of sounding like someone who is a part of this 50s/60s - quick talking world , her nervous west coast girl delivery sounds sorely out of place like the picture of the time - travelling hipster .

title: Losing the Incredibles Magic
review: The closest voice actor to get to the delivery was Bob Odenkirk ,

title: Losing the Incredibles Magic
review: but even he would sound out of place if he was casted in the original film

title: Losing the Incredibles Magic
review: and kept the same delivery .

title: Losing the Incredibles Magic
review: This aspect is hard to explain in words

title: Losing the Incredibles Magic
review: and this is more of guttural reaction to the dialogue , but hopefully if you re - watch the original you can tell too .

title: Losing the Incredibles Magic
review: The other aspect was how much this film just felt so standard .

title: Losing the Incredibles Magic
review: It has X number of action scenes , it has Y number of funny scenes , it needed to have 5 Jack Jack scenes , etc etc .

title: Losing the Incredibles Magic
review: The magic of the first film was how reserved the animation was to let the character designs , subtle facial animation , and dialogue shine .

title: Losing the Incredibles Magic
review: It is amazing how re - watchable the First Act is being it was primarily in a gray office building .

title: Losing the Incredibles Magic
review: There are so many scenes in the original Incredibles that were shot - reverse shot .

title: Losing the Incredibles Magic
review: A true sign of a director following an inspired vision to the end .

title: Losing the Incredibles Magic
review: What about the Incredibles 2 ? It relies heavily on a compilation of scenes that halt the progress of the plot to produce oohs , aahs , and laughter ( talking to you Jack Jack , raccoon , and Edna ) instead of quality scenes that can do the same ( albeit less flashy ) and give us insight into characters and conflicts .

title: Losing the Incredibles Magic
review: Overall , I can not discredit the Incredibles 2 too much for these aspects because these aspects are what I got from the original , me alone .

title: Losing the Incredibles Magic
review: If you want to watch a 3D animated movie with your family , go ahead

title: Losing the Incredibles Magic
review: and pop this on your living room screen ,

title: Losing the Incredibles Magic
review: but if you want to watch a movie like the Incredibles , you will probably be disappointed .

review: So it makes sense that The Incredibles 2 could capture that level of attention from me even after seeing it 3 times .

title: An Incredibly Neccesary Story: A Cooper Knight Original Review
review: What works for The Incredibles 2 goes as follows : Helen Parr"s investigation into the ScreenSlaver"s tyrannical governing of consumers parallels well with contemporary investigations into the U. S. Government"s utilization of social media to control consumers .

review: Disclosure : The traumatic stress may well be a jig after losing his parents at a younger age , giving Winston more reason to make Super Heroes legal .

review: What could have been improved goes as follows : Not much that I can think of .

title: Will surely win over a whole new generation of fans
review: The superhero genre has changed massively in the 14 years since Pixar and Brad Bird"s spectacular The Incredibles .

title: Will surely win over a whole new generation of fans
review: We now live in a world where a talking raccoon and sentient tree can make their way into the general audience"s hearts and an African king can rake in over $ 1 billion at the box - office .

title: Will surely win over a whole new generation of fans
review: The genre arguably reached its peak in terms of ambition , scope and pure spectacle earlier this year with Avengers : Infinity War , so a sequel to Bird"s excellent and heartfelt 2004 romp was becoming increasingly unlikely - and unnecessary - as the years rolled by .

title: Will surely win over a whole new generation of fans
review: Whether the creatives had a change of heart or Disney simply insisted , Incredibles 2 has finally arrived to try

title: Will surely win over a whole new generation of fans
review: and prove that it"s still relevant in a time when it feels like we get another superhero movie every month .

title: Will surely win over a whole new generation of fans
review: With a heavy dose of visual pizzazz and a ton of heart , Incredibles 2 certainly hits the mark while naturally paling in comparison to its relatively flawless predecessor .

title: Will surely win over a whole new generation of fans
review: Completely ignoring the 14 years that have gone by in real time , this sequel picks up immediately after the climax of the first film , with the suited - up Parr family - Mr. Incredible ( Craig T. Nelson ) , Elastigirl ( Holly Hunter ) , Violet ( Sarah Vowell ) , Dash ( Huck Milner ) and baby Jack - Jack ( Eli Fucile ) - facing off with the newest villain in town , The Underminer ( John Ratzenberger ) .

title: Will surely win over a whole new generation of fans
review: Their scuffle with the burrowing thief causes collateral damage throughout the city ,

title: Will surely win over a whole new generation of fans
review: and in response the government shuts down the Superhero Relocation Program , leaving the Parrs homeless and without financial support .

title: Will surely win over a whole new generation of fans
review: They are offered a glimmer of hope when CEO and superhero fan Winston Deavor ( Bob Odenkirk ) reveals his desire to put the crime - fighters back in the public eye and remind the world of their importance .

title: Will surely win over a whole new generation of fans
review: Helped by his tech genius sister Evelyn ( Catherine Keener ) , Winston favours the clinical elegance of Elastigirl"s powers over Mr. Incredible"s destructive brute strength , so while she is out battling a mysterious new criminal called Screenslaver , he is tasked with tending to the kids .

title: Will surely win over a whole new generation of fans
review: Splitting up the central characters is a popular approach for many sequels ,

title: Will surely win over a whole new generation of fans
review: and here it seems like a natural way to further explore the themes of family bonds and individuality of the first film .

title: Will surely win over a whole new generation of fans
review: Elastigirl savours her chance to shine , demonstrating a range of formidable powers which allow for some spectacular and beautifully - rendered action sequences .

title: Will surely win over a whole new generation of fans
review: Most of the biggest laughs come from Mr. Incredible"s struggle to handle his new responsibilities , as his face becomes increasingly haggard

title: Will surely win over a whole new generation of fans
review: and grey with stubble .

title: Will surely win over a whole new generation of fans
review: Dash needs help with his maths homework and Violet has boy troubles ,

title: Will surely win over a whole new generation of fans
review: but his biggest obstacle is ensuring Jack - Jack doesn"t cause accidental mass destruction with his combination of laser vision , dimension - hopping and morphing into a literal flaming devil .

title: Will surely win over a whole new generation of fans
review: Jack - Jack is usually the kind of animated character that has adults rolling their eyes ,

title: Will surely win over a whole new generation of fans
review: but his combination of wide - eyed innocence and clumsy displays of limitless power is utterly charming , in particular his encounter with a hungry ( and soon to be sorry ) raccoon .

title: Will surely win over a whole new generation of fans
review: Incredibles 2 doesn"t offer anything new to the genre or anything in the way of surprise ,

title: Will surely win over a whole new generation of fans
review: but it does its thing with style and care , allowing every character - including the returning Samuel L. Jackson as Frozone - their moment in the spotlight .

title: Will surely win over a whole new generation of fans
review: 14 years after thrilling one generation , this sequel is sure to bring the next one on board .

review: A sequel to one of Pixar"s most beloved films , Incredibles 2 delivers in almost every way -

review: and even when it falters , you"re having too much fun to notice .

review: Pixar"s track record with sequels is somewhat mixed .

title: Fantastic
review: In the case of Toy Story , the trilogy has proved a resounding success .

title: Fantastic
review: With the likes of Finding Dory , however , the result proved somewhat lacklustre ,

title: Fantastic
review: and the less said about Cars 2 the better .

title: Fantastic
review: Learning that Disney planned a sequel to the hugely popular Incredibles ( 14 years after its original release ) , I approached it with a slight skepticism .

title: Fantastic
review: Would the characters be able to bear the weight of a sequel ? Could they maintain the stylish and fresh atmosphere of the original ? Would the film collapse under its own hype , leaving everyone extremely disappointed ? Yet , as soon as Michael Giacchino"s classic score roared into the cinema , my fears were soon put to rest .

title: Fantastic
review: Following directly on from the events of the first film , Incredibles 2 picks up with the Underminer"s attack on the Metroville Bank .

title: Fantastic
review: The sequence , perhaps one of the finest action scenes in animation history , is dizzyingly fun , giving each of the family a chance to showcase the superpowers that we all know and love ( save perhaps Jack - Jack ,

title: Fantastic
review: but more on that later ) .

title: Fantastic
review: After this , the main plot kicks in , with Bob , Helen and Frozone recruited by a business tycoon hoping to make superheroes legal once again .

title: Fantastic
review: What follows sees a twist to the original , with Elastagirl taking on the crime - fighting responsibilities , with Bob left at home to deal with Violet"s mood swings , Dash"s homework - and the discovery of Jack - Jack"s many , MANY powers .

title: Fantastic
review: If there is one true strength to the film , Incredibles 2 is constantly hilarious .

title: Fantastic
review: Whether it be a set - piece battle between Jack - Jack and a racoon ( a real highlight ) or just throw - away lines , the script maintains an energy and buoyancy throughout .

title: Fantastic
review: The film , as one would expect , is beautifully animated ,

title: Fantastic
review: and highlights a clear technological advancement since it"s predecessor .

title: Fantastic
review: It"s hard to imagine some of the impressive showdowns of super - heroics in the final act to be carried out with the same gravitas back in 2004 .

title: Fantastic
review: Indeed , this sequel has advanced with the modern world in a number of ways , with Elastagirl"s more central role fully embracing female empowerment .

title: Fantastic
review: The film is not inherently political ,

title: Fantastic
review: but rather embraces more current sensibilities , even within it"s 60s - inspired narrative framework .

title: Fantastic
review: If there is one gripe that I had with the film , then it"s the villain .

title: Fantastic
review: The Screenslaver lacks the particular menace or motivations in the early section of the film ,

title: Fantastic
review: and their true identity ( which I will not divulge here ) is somewhat expected .

title: Fantastic
review: This is particularly infuriating in comparison to Syndrome , Mr. Incredible"s " Number One Fan " from the original , who had considerable depth and a strong personal connection to Bob .

title: Fantastic
review: But it"s hard to let this detail drag you down when the rest of the cast is so strong .

title: Fantastic
review: Craig T. Nelson brings incredible comic potential to Mr. Incredible , while Holly Hunter provides a grounded and relatable presence .

title: Fantastic
review: The return of Edna Mode is always welcome ,

title: Fantastic
review: and Jack - Jack steals absolutely every scene that he"s in .

title: Fantastic
review: Witty , fast - paced and surprisingly relevant , Incredibles 2 is a worthy sequel to its classic counterpart ,

title: Fantastic
review: and proves that good things really do come to those who wait .

title: Fantastic
review: Even if it"s 14 years .

review: but maybe we"ve become accustomed to Marvel"s structure ... On the other hand , it"s impossible to walk out of Incredibles 2 without noticing some of the powerful messages conveyed ; specifically it"s brilliantly relevant and timely feminist message .

title: "Incredible" Film That Was Worth The Wait
review: Let"s face it - Elastigirl is a better hero than Mr. Incredible ; he"s basically a non - green Hulk who hits things hard whereas there"s no limit to what Elastigirl can do by contorting her body - she absolutely deserves the spotlight in this sequel .

title: "Incredible" Film That Was Worth The Wait
review: But more than that , Elastigirl"s role in this film demonstrates another sense of female empowerment that Disney is doing so well at the moment .

title: "Incredible" Film That Was Worth The Wait
review: Not that Helen Parr is ready to stand up to the likes of Elsa and Moana ,

title: "Incredible" Film That Was Worth The Wait
review: but it"s definitely a step in the right direction and a good female role model for the young audience .

title: "Incredible" Film That Was Worth The Wait
review: The sequel also gives us an opportunity to enjoy more of the family dynamics within the Parr family .

title: "Incredible" Film That Was Worth The Wait
review: Although edging on the patronising side , seeing Bob cope with the reversal of the traditional roles adds in a nice bit of comedy , particularly his exhausted face as he deals with Jack - Jack"s refusal to sleep and his rising frustration in the face of Math he was never taught .

title: "Incredible" Film That Was Worth The Wait
review: Incredibles 2 allows more of a focus on the family itself , giving the film a more unique feel to the original .

title: "Incredible" Film That Was Worth The Wait
review: As a result , we see a little more of each character ; we see more of Violet and her effort to deal with her teenage angst ; we see much more of Frozone ;

title: "Incredible" Film That Was Worth The Wait
review: and we even see a more maternal side to Edna ... It"s even better to see more of Jack - Jack , a character who was noticeably side - lined for most of the original .

title: "Incredible" Film That Was Worth The Wait
review: However the best returning aspect is the style itself .

title: "Incredible" Film That Was Worth The Wait
review: As with the first film , Incredibles 2 marries the 60s era James Bond style with the superhero genre - a beautiful match made in heaven ; Michael Giacchino"s rollicking brass - dominated score is stronger than ever , strongly evocative of the old Bonds ,

title: "Incredible" Film That Was Worth The Wait
review: and the set design is impeccable .

title: "Incredible" Film That Was Worth The Wait
review: I don"t know if it was just me ,

title: "Incredible" Film That Was Worth The Wait
review: but on top of everything else the music and aesthetic was one of my favourite parts of The Incredibles and I"m just happy it"s as good in the sequel as it was back in 2004 .

title: "Incredible" Film That Was Worth The Wait
review: Waiting for sequels ( whether we know they"re coming or not ) is not unusual ; after all there were over 30 years between the two Top Gun and Blade Runner films and more than 50 years in between the two Mary Poppins outings , not to mention the countless gaps between Star Wars and James Bond films ... Even Finding Dory came out 13 years after Finding Nemo .

title: "Incredible" Film That Was Worth The Wait
review: On the whole , I think it"s safe to say that the sequels we wait for are worth waiting for ( let"s forget Godfather : Part III and Indiana Jones and the Kingdom of the Crystal Skull for now ... ) .

title: "Incredible" Film That Was Worth The Wait
review: It may be 14 years since the original but Incredibles 2 is just as enjoyable as the first .

title: "Incredible" Film That Was Worth The Wait
review: Though it may lack the bold heart and strong messages of the first , the characters are out in full force , kicking ass

title: "Incredible" Film That Was Worth The Wait
review: and making audiences laugh in style .

title: "Incredible" Film That Was Worth The Wait
review: This is the sequel we wanted - able to stand proudly amongst other superhero films that have come out in the meantime .

title: "Incredible" Film That Was Worth The Wait
review: As was integral to the film itself , Incredibles 2 is proof that we need more of Pixar"s Supers ! P. S. The Pixar short film before the film starts is just as adorable as ever ( especially once you get to the end ) .

title: A long-deserving sequel that exceeds expectations but some flaws in its quality.

review: Another flaw of the movie was the pacing which comes off the rails and sometimes affect the quality of this film .

title: "... and don't fire the baby inside the house!"
review: ... Is the funniest line in this totally entertaining sequel .

title: "... and don't fire the baby inside the house!"
review: That"s particularly appropriate because you can make a good case that the main character ( if there is one ) whose story arc runs through the whole film is baby Jack - Jack , who"s cheerfully and accidentally discovering his wide array of " powers " that the rest of the Parrs have to learn to manage .

title: "... and don't fire the baby inside the house!"
review: The best sequence in the whole movie , I thought , was an extended dust - up between Jack - Jack and an amazingly plucky and persistent raccoon .

title: "... and don't fire the baby inside the house!"
review: ( ! ) In the midst of a film built on charming homage and spoofing of superhero movies , that scene stands out as totally original .

title: "... and don't fire the baby inside the house!"
review: The little guy is incredibly cute ( it"s the eyes ) ,

title: "... and don't fire the baby inside the house!"
review: and wait till you see what happens now when he sneezes .

title: "... and don't fire the baby inside the house!"
review: The rest of what I"ll say is a bunch of my favorite bits , so if you haven"t seen the movie yet , you might not want to read further -- come on back later .

title: "... and don't fire the baby inside the house!"
review: I give this an 8/10 because it"s not deep ,

title: "... and don't fire the baby inside the house!"
review: but it"s well crafted fun from beginning to end , absolutely worth a night at the cinema .

title: "... and don't fire the baby inside the house!"
review: Incredibles 2 as a sequel doesn"t have the advantage of being an origin story ( which I generally like , unlike some viewers ) ,

title: "... and don't fire the baby inside the house!"
review: but there are lots of inventive touches with the obligatory fight and chase scenes , and somewhat surprisingly the first third of the movie -- where all the setup happens -- is actually quite measured , deliberate , and ( gasp ! ) almost adult in feel .

title: "... and don't fire the baby inside the house!"
review: Once you suspend disbelief to put yourself in a world where Supers exist , a lot of good questions come up .

title: "... and don't fire the baby inside the house!"
review: What about collateral damage to ordinary people and property , which most superhero movies ( and comics ) skate right past ? Money problems too -- if your profession is " superhero " and that"s what you"re good at , how do you make a living if that job has been outlawed ?

title: "... and don't fire the baby inside the house!"
review: And if it"s a whole family of them , how do they all get their share of the action when school , groceries , and baby care always need managing ? All the Parrs and their buddy Frozone have good scenes with lots of side material .

title: "... and don't fire the baby inside the house!"
review: Bob learns in - the - trenches parenting .

title: "... and don't fire the baby inside the house!"
review: Violet goes back and forth with her targetted to - be - boyfriend Nick ( who"s been rehabilitated into a decent kid from the jock - in - training that he was in the original ) .

title: "... and don't fire the baby inside the house!"
review: Dash gets dad"s old supercar to play with .

title: "... and don't fire the baby inside the house!"
review: And especially , Helen gets lots of action on her own recovering her old superheroing ( superheroine - ing ? ) days .

title: "... and don't fire the baby inside the house!"
review: There are loads of other nice touches .

title: "... and don't fire the baby inside the house!"
review: The Parrs are given the run of an unused mansion built by " an eccentric billionaire who wanted lots of secret entrances " ( thanks , Bruce Wayne ) .

title: "... and don't fire the baby inside the house!"
review: The runaway - favorite character Edna Mold is a ringer for famous old - Hollywood fashion designer Edith Head , which fits nicely into the understated retro feel of the whole production ( no one seems to be using cellphones , for example ) .

title: "... and don't fire the baby inside the house!"
review: And near the end , there"s a sequence where some of our heroes are wearing luminous goggles that turn them into zombies obeying the villain"s commands .

title: "... and don't fire the baby inside the house!"
review: They look passively out of the screen at the audience , who are in turn looking back with our 3D glasses . Weird meta moment .

title: "... and don't fire the baby inside the house!"
review: I like that the cartoon style of Incredibles 2 is a very close match to the original , which was an essential part of its charm .

title: "... and don't fire the baby inside the house!"
review: No attempts here at something glossier and more advanced like e. G. How to Train Your Dragon did with its sequel -- as the artwork becomes more " real " it also becomes less pure fun , like comics we read as kids .

title: "... and don't fire the baby inside the house!"
review: Now the costumes : while Frozone has his complete body suit covering almost his whole head , the Parrs have these little black masks that don"t disguise anything but nevertheless seem to work , like Clark Kent"s glasses .

title: "... and don't fire the baby inside the house!"
review: Another fun bit is how the masks stretch

title: "... and don't fire the baby inside the house!"
review: and compress with their facial expressions .

title: "... and don't fire the baby inside the house!"
review: One improvement with the artwork is the hair ( Helen gets several scenes on her high - speed motorcycle with hair blowing pretty realistically , and she has lots of closeups that are really quite expressive .

title: "... and don't fire the baby inside the house!"
review: ) However , there"s something odd that has happened in the 14 years between the original Incredibles and its sequel .

title: "... and don't fire the baby inside the house!"
review: Special effects and CGI in live - action superhero movies have advanced so much that the ground between them and actual cartoon / comics has almost closed .

title: "... and don't fire the baby inside the house!"
review: In other words , watching The Incredibles ( 1 or 2 ) doesn"t feel radically different from Avengers Infinity War , which is the closest yet to replicating what happens in superhero comics .

title: "... and don't fire the baby inside the house!"
review: Not that this is a complaint .

title: "Incredibles 2" upholds the Parrs as one of the best families in the history of cinema
review: Luck or fate , my childhood , like those of thousands of human beings , was strongly influenced by Disney / Pixar"s wonderful , sophisticated tales , which I saw on TV without any prejudice or criticism over and over again , movies that always were a healthy , high - quality entertainment .

title: "Incredibles 2" upholds the Parrs as one of the best families in the history of cinema
review: If I revisit these films today , I can possibly question certain aspects due to the passage of time and that"s completely natural because a flick can be perceived in a myriad of ways according to age , mood or state of mind of the viewer .

title: "Incredibles 2" upholds the Parrs as one of the best families in the history of cinema
review: One thing that definitely seems to have been proven with unfading solidity is the thought that they"re truly complex audiovisual works , these movies were the beginning of a kinetic digital era for animation genre that currently keeps going on both destroying box office expectations and exciting and teaching the new children with creativeness , passion , and effort .

title: "Incredibles 2" upholds the Parrs as one of the best families in the history of cinema
review: Although not all Disney - Pixar - made movies of the 21st century are modern classics , there are time - worthy pieces of art with visual tidiness and original , heartfelt storyline execution that keep alive- and many nonfans have complained about this - the " Disney formula " that inspires hope , union , forgiveness and improvement .

title: "Incredibles 2" upholds the Parrs as one of the best families in the history of cinema
review: That"s why the first movie of the Parr family is so intimately untouchable for me , just like a few others beautiful animated films .

review: Even with its unimportant flaws , it saved the 2000"s superhero genre

title: The Best Pixar Sequel Since Toy Story 3
review: Thank God for Pixar .

title: The Best Pixar Sequel Since Toy Story 3
review: Each time I"m convinced every CG - kid"s movie monstrosity looks like the same plastic , soulless bombardment of color as the next , they come along

title: The Best Pixar Sequel Since Toy Story 3
review: and remind us why they are the undefeated champs of animation .

title: The Best Pixar Sequel Since Toy Story 3
review: Even in their sequels , like their most recent Incredibles 2 , there"s a crispness and attention - to - detail that far exceeds their contemporaries .

title: The Best Pixar Sequel Since Toy Story 3
review: But Pixar has always been story first ,

title: The Best Pixar Sequel Since Toy Story 3
review: and Incredibles 2 continues that tradition , giving us their best sequel since Toy Story 3 .

title: The Best Pixar Sequel Since Toy Story 3
review: Picking up right where the original left off , the Parr family - of - superheroes are still learning to juggle school , work and home life , all while trying to go unnoticed in a world that has made vigilantism illegal .

title: The Best Pixar Sequel Since Toy Story 3
review: When Elastigirl is offered a new job that will help supers gain back some public credibility , things only become more complicated , especially when Jack - Jack"s powers start taking shape ( a fight between the baby and a raccoon is the highlight of the film ) .

title: The Best Pixar Sequel Since Toy Story 3
review: The mid-20th century aesthetics are still wonderfully strong ,

title: The Best Pixar Sequel Since Toy Story 3
review: and the action scenes are even more inventive , exciting and cohesive than the already stellar first one .

title: The Best Pixar Sequel Since Toy Story 3
review: Best yet , it beautifully presents a truly female - forward family adventure without ignoring the implicated difficulties of a changing time .

title: The Best Pixar Sequel Since Toy Story 3
review: Like most sequels , it doesn"t quite match the heights of its predecessor .

title: The Best Pixar Sequel Since Toy Story 3
review: Familiarity , plot clichés , flat jokes , and obnoxiously obvious twists are scattered throughout .

title: The Best Pixar Sequel Since Toy Story 3
review: However , what makes this series great is the family - life stuff ,

title: The Best Pixar Sequel Since Toy Story 3
review: and director Bird clearly recognizes that .

title: The Best Pixar Sequel Since Toy Story 3
review: Marriage is hard ; parenting is hard ; family is hard ; no superpower can change that ,

title: The Best Pixar Sequel Since Toy Story 3
review: yet no difficulty can defeat true love .

title: The Best Pixar Sequel Since Toy Story 3
review: ( SIDE NOTE : make sure to get there in time for the honest and hilarious pre - film short " Bao " ) .
